latestInfos.content:
Call update flash info

CERV-2022-DAPHNE - Call for proposals to prevent and combat gender-based violence and violence against children

Publication date:           22 November 2021

Type of action:             CERV Project Grants

Opening date:               15 December 2021

Single-stage

Deadline:                     26 April 2022 17:00:00

Call's budget:               30 500 000 EUR

           

In 2022 the call had 5 Priorities:

  • Priority 1 - Large-scale and long-term transnational actions to tackle gender-based violence. Trans-national proposals are expected to focus on one of the following areas: domestic violence, harmful practices, gender-based cyber-violence, violence and harassment in the world of work.
    • Indicative budget: EUR 12 000 000
    • 39 eligible proposals were received
  • Priority 2 - Combating and preventing violence linked to harmful practices   
    • Indicative budget:  EUR 6 000 000
    • 14 eligible proposals were received
  • Priority 3 – Primary prevention of gender-based violence
    • Indicative budget:  EUR 7 000 000
    • 145 eligible proposals were received
  • Priority 4 – Supporting and improving national data collection on violence against children
    • Indicative budget:  EUR 3 000 000
    • 14 eligible proposals were received
  • Priority 5 – Strengthening responses that prevent and support child victims of violence by reinforcing child protection systems at national and local level
    • Indicative budget:  EUR 2 500 000
    • 46 eligible proposals were received

The results of the evaluation were communicated to the applicants via the Funding and Tenders Portal on 25 October 2022.

Summary of the results:

Under the Priority 1 of the call

·     Award a grant to 7 proposals for the amount of EUR 10.433.337,45. While the total indicative budget for this priority is equal to EUR 12.000.000, EUR 1.566.662,55 will be shifted to fund more projects under priority 3.

·     Place 3 proposals on the reserve list for the amount of EUR 4.756.857,74

·     Reject 9 proposals for lack of budget

·     Reject 20 proposals due to insufficient relevance and/or quality

 

Under the Priority 2 of the call

·     Award a grant to 10 proposals for the amount of EUR 5.598.905,30. While the total indicative budget for this priority is equal to EUR 6.000.000, EUR 401.094,70 will be shifted to fund more projects under priority 3.

·     Place no proposal on the reserve list

·     Reject 1 proposal for lack of budget

·     Reject 3 proposals due to insufficient relevance and/or quality

·     Reject 2 inadmissible/ineligible proposals


Under the Priority 3 of the call

·     Award a grant to 17 proposals for the amount of EUR 8.957.749,99 (out of the total indicative budget of  EUR 7.000.000 foreseen for this Priority, plus a budget reinforcement of EUR 1.967.757,25 coming from left-overs of priorities 1 and 2) 

·     Place 5 proposals on the reserve list for the amount of EUR 2.762.687,72

·     Reject 50 proposals for lack of budget

·     Reject 73 proposals due to insufficient relevance and/or quality

·     Reject 8 inadmissible/ineligible proposals


Under the Priority 4 of the call

·     Award a grant to 6 proposals for the amount of EUR 2.881.262,31 (out of the total indicative budget of  EUR 3.000.000 foreseen for this Priority, the left-over of EUR 118.737,69 is transferred to Priority 5) 

·     Place 3 proposals on the reserve list for the amount of EUR 1.223.300,78

·     Reject 3 proposals for lack of budget

·     Reject 2 proposals due to insufficient relevance and/or quality


Under the Priority 5 of the call

·     Award a grant to 6 proposals for the amount of EUR 2.639.983,30 (the total indicative budget of  EUR 2.500.000 foreseen for this Priority has been reinforced with the left-over from Priority 4) 

·     Place 3 proposals on the reserve list for the amount of EUR 1.562.607,28

·     Reject 21 proposals for lack of budget

·     Reject 16 proposals due to insufficient relevance and/or quality

  •   Reject 1 ineligible proposal
Please note that the submission deadline of CERV-2022-DAPHNE call has been postponed to 26 April 17:00 CET.
Presentations and questions from the online Info Session of 4 February 2022 are available on the event page under "Downloads".
An online Info Session on the call CERV-2022-DAPHNE will take place on 4 February 2022 10:00-12:00 CET. More information here.

TopicDetails.description:
Scope:

With this call, divided into 5 priorities, we aim at financing projects that will:

  • integrate prevention of various forms of gender-based violence against women in different contexts, with a systemic approach (priority 1, “large-scale projects”)
  • tackle harmful practices against women and girls (priority 2)
  • prevent gender-based violence by tackling its root causes (priority 3)
  • support and improve national data collection on violence against children (priority 4)
  • strengthen responses that prevent and support child victims of violence by reinforcing child protection systems at national and local level (priority 5)

For more information please see the Call document.
TopicDetails.conditions:
1.   Eligible countries: as described in the Call document. 

Member States of the European Union (including their overseas departments).

2.   Eligibility and admissibility conditions: as described in the Call document.

3.   Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.

4.   Evaluation

Evaluation criteria, scoring, threshold and process are described in the Call document.

5.   Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: as described in the Call document.

6.   Proposal templates, guidance, model grant agreements (MGA) and reference documents:

Standard proposal template

Call document

Mono/Multi-beneficiary Model Grant Agreement

CERV 2021-2022 work programme

Regulation establishing the CERV Programme
TopicDetails.supportInfo:
For help related to this call, please contact: EC-CERV-CALLS@ec.europa.eu

You can contact CERV national contact points for support in your language. You can find all contact points here: CERV national contact points list

Funding & Tenders Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals.

IT Helpdesk – Contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Online Manual – Please be aware that the Manual is currently drafted for the H2020 Programme and may not entirely fit for other programmes. However, a revision is being completed to make it corporate.
TopicDetails.sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service, please click on the submission-button next to the type of action and the type of model grant agreement that corresponds to your proposal. You will then be asked to confirm your choice, as it cannot be changed in the submission system. Upon confirmation, you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Funding & Tenders Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
